profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-24 09:30:04 -0400.

repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into six series: Grant Files; Team and Committee Minutes and Notes; Administrative Files; Slide Library; Additional Accessions; and Publications.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Initial transfer of materials for this collection consisted on 10 boxes from Cora Ho, Deputy Director of the Hirsh Health Sciences Library until December, 2011. Files included her own papers as well as the papers of previous directors and the library as a whole.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Series 4, Binder 7 titles were all supplied by archivist. Accession UA-2022-022 was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist, Jane Kelly, in Fall 2021. Material was placed in an archival box. Series- and collection-level description was updated at the time of processing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains grant files, correspondence, memoranda, announcements, flyers, minutes, annual reports, library statistics, budget survey, and other administrative files, from 1924 to 2010. It also includes electronic files originally stored in several different types of media of which 3 1‚ÅÑ2-inch floppy disks and 5 1/2-inch floppy disks are dominant. Additionally, there are a few VHS tapes, audio cassettes, CDs, and a DLTtape. The bulk of the materials was created and compiled by the Directors and Deputy Directors of the Library, such as Elizabeth Eaton and Cora Ho, from the mid-1980s to the 2000s. The records also include materials created prior to the official founding of a separate health sciences library at Tufts, as well as materials that pre-date the establishment of the Hirsh Health Sciences Library in 2005.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Health Sciences Library (2005-) was opened in 2005 with a donation from pharmaceutical CEO Jane Hirsh and named in honor of her, her husband Dr. Mark Hirsh (DG68), and her two children, who also graduated from Tufts University.

The library is located on the fourth floor of the Tufts Center for Medical Education building, formerly the Arthur M. Sackler Center for Health Communications, and is administered by the Tufts University Medical School. The library's collections support education for Tufts University's School of Medicine, School of Dental Medicine, Friedman School of Nutrition Science and Policy, Tufts New England Medical Center, and Tufts Graduate School of Biomedical Sciences. Eric Albright has been the library's director since its opening in April 2005.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Hirsh Health Sciences Library Records, 1893 -- 2013. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains grant applications, project proposals, evaluations, and other related documents on behalf of the Hirsh Health Sciences Library and its predecessor library on the Tufts Boston Campus. A large portion of files are associated with programs from National Science Foundation (NSF) and National Library of Medicine (NLM). The bulk of the documents were created in the 1990s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series was arranged in the order it was received.

scopecontent.p: Final reports from SPIRAL: Selected Patient Information Resources in Asian Languages, a grant-funded project from the New England Region of the National Network of Libraries of Medicine under contract N01-LM-6-3508.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by Amy LaVertu, Research and Instruction Librarian, Hirsch Health Sciences Library, in November 2019, accession number UA-2020-032.

did.unittitle: Team and Committee minutes and notes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains meeting minutes, memoranda, correspondence and budget files mostly pertaining to Health Science Library cabinet meetings, staff meetings, and committee meetings. The bulk of the files was created between 1980 and 2000.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged chronologically within meeting type.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: University records are closed for 20 years from date of creation. Some material in this series is minimally processed and may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains various administrative files including surveys, annual reports, statistics, budget proposals, memoranda, correspondence, flyers, personal certificates, newsletters, journals, LCME accreditation self-study material, and the Hirsh Health Sciences Library disaster plan and policies. The series contains physical materials as well as a large number of digital files that were originally housed on a wide variety of portable media. The bulk of the materials was created from the 1990s to the 2000s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged as received with electronic files cataloged at the end of the physical materials unless they were interfiled. Later accessions were added after the electronic files in the order in which they were received.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 20 years from date of creation. Open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains slides created and collected by Dr. Henry H. Banks as part of his research for his historical book celebrating the centennial of the School of Medicine, "A Century of Excellence: The History of Tufts University School of Medicine 1893-1993." There are images of the School of Medicine, its staff and students. There are also slides highlighting statistics about the School tuition, enrollment, loans, and financial aid from the 1980s and 1990s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged as found.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series/sub-series contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes publications created by and pertaining to Tufts School of Medicine, Dental School of Medicine, Cummings School of Veterinary Medicine, and Hirsh Library. There are also some publications and manuals from Tufts central administration. Materials include student handbooks, bulletins, yearbooks, newsletters, magazines, alumni directories, journals, school histories, annual reports, policy statements and plans, and other printed materials. There are also a small number of U-Matic tapes from the Global Classroom project, and some paper ephemera such as tickets to an anatomy demonstration.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by Fran Foret in the Hirsh Health Sciences Library, 2009, accession 2009.071.
